headline: Jalapeno Popper Cups
description: Mini phyllo cups filled with a creamy, cheesy jalapeno filling are a more sophisticated version of the jalapeno popper.
name: Jalapeno Popper Cups

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place phyllo cups onto a baking sheet.

Stir together cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, jalapenos, and hot sauce in a bowl. Spoon mixture into phyllo cups. Sprinkle bacon bits on top. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 15 to 20 minutes. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: Made these for St Paddy's Day and they were a huge hit!! I couldn't find pre cut phyllo so I had a mini pan and used 1 wide mouth shot glass to make the circles and another to push down into the pan. Be sure to use a fork around the inside. It rises like pie crust.

My neighbor made these and brought them over just as the big game started. They were so delicious!! I like them alot better than the recipe that uses the entire jalapeno. she added some chopped green onion to it.

Excellent recipe! I also love it with variations— in scoops instead of phillo, or as a quick microwave dip with chips or carrots. I have also tried using sriracha in place of other hot sauce and crumbled leftover bacon in place of bacon bits. I think I may try making a vegetarian version with diced field roast plant pepperonis in place of bacon. It’s hard to go wrong with this one!
excellent little treats, great flavor!!

The recipe was very easy to follow. I had several fillo trays in my freezer and needed to make some appetizers for pool guests. They were a hit. It made me feel like I was a great cook and was a hit of the night. We played cards and munched on them so much we skipped bbq'ng dinner. We also used the stuffed mushroom and the cannoli recipe.
This was a total hit! I followed the suggestion of others and used "Scoops" tortilla chips instead of pastry, to make a gluten-free version.

I made it first with corn tortilla strips and they were excellent. Then being a Gringo tortilla cook I used a mini muffin pan and made cups from Masa Harina with my corn tortilla recipe. They were even better.
Can this recipe be made ahead of time then warmed in the microwave?
These are amazing and so easy! I have made them twice now. I premake the filling and stuff and bake them when I am ready to eat.

I have made these twice. The second time I used flour tortillas and cut them to fit muffin tin. Sprayed the shells with canola oil and filled them with the mixture. The hubbs thought just a little to much wing sauce. I will continue to make these as they are so yummy!
Made these for Superbowl and they were so good! will definitely make again!
I put the jalapeños on the bbq and charred them. Put in a zip lock and steam for about 5 min. Skin

These were amazing! I didn't have phyllo dough or tostitos scoop chips on hand, so I used flaky dough in the can. I separated each biscuit into 3 different layers into a muffin pan, then filled with double the recipe and topped with bacon bits. The bacon bits I was skeptical about at first, but they are what made the final taste better...
Turned out delicious but instead of using phyllo shells I used Tostitos scoops and filled with the jalapeno mix. Turned out great. Everyone loved it.
I absolutely love these and so do my foster parents we will definitely make these again
So Yummy, I didn't have fresh jalapeno's so I used picked ones.

These were so delicious.
I used almost a whole tall jar of jalapeños instead of fresh...a box of cream cheese, 1 cup shredded cheddar and two boxes of phyllo cups. (Plus dash of hot sauce and bacon bits on top of course)
Turned out great!
Next time I want to try everyones scoops corn chip idea! (Phyllo is expensive!)

I recently took this to a Superbowl party and it was a huge hit! So easy to make too. I had everything at home but the jalapenos and phyllo cups. FYI they are in the freezer section if anyone has a hard time finding them at the grocery store! 

Lastly, I had a lot of leftover filling because I doubled the recipe (..and some), so I used the rest to make stuffed chicken. SO GOOD.
Will definitely make again. Very good
I liked them. Nice Super Bowl appetizer. Substituted sliced turkey for the plyllo (keto) and used muffin tins sprayed with Pam. It worked out well.
A great Super Bowl appetizer, not as hot as a regular jalapeño popper
Makes good pinwheels too
Excellent ! So good what a hit! You have to bake the phyllo cups before to keep them crispy for hours ! Read the directions on the box !
My family loved these. I will definitely make these again.
Very tasty, albeit spicy. Big hit at our Super Bowl party. Definitely will make again!
Followed recipe and used phyllo cup. Very good and flaky.

This was an amazing recipe. My husband really liked them. Only issue is dealing with the phyllo. Couldn't find phyllo tarts so cut small squares and used mini muffin tins. Made 24 and makes great appetizers!
Very delicious

WOW! These were amazing. I did put my own spin on them and took advice of other reviewers.
I sauteed the chopped jalapenos, then added a couple of tblsp of pineapple jam. added the cream cheese, the cheddar and about a tbsp of apple habanero bbq sauce. Added half a pound of chopped bacon and put all that in a ziplock bag and let it sit over night. The next day, I let it warm up some, and piped it into Scoops. Topped with the other half pound of chopped bacon, and cooked at 300 degrees for about 20 minutes. So good, had lots of party goers come up to me and ask to share the recipe. Will definitely make these again.

My now 11 year old son and I have been making these for your years as he loves the crunch of the phyllo tart shells. Easy recipe to make with kids as well. I usually leave out the hot pepper sauce since he his younger and it is something we do not miss in the recipe.
Tastes great. I liked it just as much in a Tostito Scoop as in the phillo cup. I agree with a a previous comment that the 2 jalapenos were needed.
They were gone in less than 5 minutes!
Went to a potluck and everyone loved it

These disappeared quickly! Delicious and easy. I didn't use bacon because I had vegetarian guests but I didn't feel like I missed out on anything. Also used pickled jalapenos as our grocery store didn't have fresh. Definitely a hit with everyone. Thank you!

These were delicious and they were a big hit at the super bowl party! I doubled the recipe and it made 30 cups. I followed the recipe, except I left out the hot sauce because I was afraid that it would be too hot. I did also add a dash of garlic powder. Everyone enjoyed them and I even got requests for the recipe!

12/20/18 - some changes per reviews, I used wonton wrappers instead of phyllo shells, added 1/2 cup sour cream and 1 cup cheddar, these were delicious but a little spicy for my taste. I did use 3-4 jarred jalapenos instead of fresh, might try fresh next time. Flavor was good.
WOW! Simply amazing. Took other reviewers suggestion and used Tostito's scoops and also used real bacon. The chips make it a nice gluten free alternative
I accidentally doubled the amount of cream cheese, but they turned out perfectly and I got twice as many. Delicious, beautiful, and perfect size for hors d'oeuvres.

I doubled the receipt, but thats it. I will make these again
we loved these.
Had pastry sheets and used them instead of buying new pastries
I used wantons for the cups. Did not use hot sauce and used about a cup of sour cream. Added some garlic, salt, and Tajin. Spray the pan to keep from sticking.

This rating is for the filling only (- the bacon bits).
I didn't have the phyllo cups, so I used some tortillas chips, the scoop kind, and some mushrooms. Also used only about half the jalapeno to make it kid friendly. I baked the filled chips for 15 minutes and the mushrooms for 20 minutes. 
Both were good. The kids liked the chips ones better, of course !

I made it originally as posted, loved it. In future batches I omitted the hot sauce and added scallions. I have been freezing batches as I harvest my jalapenos from the garden. This will make great appetizers for the upcoming holiday celebrations. Thank you for an easy, great recipe that everyone loves.

Made double batch as directed in the phyllo dough cups (15 per package found in the freezer section at my grocery store) and they were a hit. Had enough with double batch to fill 2.5 boxes or make ~36-37. 12 minutes is all they baked and they went VERY fast.

I made these exactly as the recipe said. Delicious! The only thing I did different is when I took them out of the oven, I put them in a slow cooker without the lid on. They stayed hot and crispy! Many people asked for the recipe!
Wonderful recipe! I used the scoop chips as well, but followed the rest of the recipe-- and this is always a huge hit!!
if you don't like it too hot - don't add the hot sauce
perfect and delicious
This is so easy and everyone LOVES it! Great quick appetizer.
These were the hit at Bunco. Very easy to make and tasty

I have now made this 3 times! I've doubled the recipe each time. It's fantastic in phyllo cups, but also really good in tostitos scoops and tonight I'm making it in a pie plate as a dip. When I doubled it I only used 3 jalapenos because they were bigger peppers. I put the bacon on top so it wouldn't get soggy. I brought them to a couple of parties and they disappeared quickly! I would definitely recommend this.
Yes, we will make it again! I added the bacon in with the jalapeno instead of sprinkling on top. We also did a batch with chopped roasted red peppers and artichokes, delicious!
My favorite app ever!!!!!!!!!

Perfectly Delicious!
Used Tostitos Scoops (not any other chip brand of "scoops" because they have round bottoms that won't sit upright on your baking sheet).
Used Diced Jalapenos in a jar (3 tablespoons DRAINED for average adult taste). I think fresh jalapenos might be too crispy in this recipe.
Any hot sauce should be fine, but I used Tabasco since it was the only one labeled as "pepper sauce".
REAL bacon bits in the zipper pouches found near the salad dressing and croutons in the store (do not use "imitation" bacon bits...totally different product).
NOT good for potlucks or large parties where several dishes are set out buffet style. These are not good cold or reheated as they will be chewy or scorched by a chaffing dish. These are perfect for a few dinner guests served as an appetizer at a barbecue or to a hoard of teenagers as a snack. Thank you Jessina!
These were great. Didn't have fresh jalapenos used pickled out of a jar husband loved them a little to hot for me. Will make them again.
This recipe is awesome. I saved a step and used Mt. Olive Diced Jalapeno Peppers. You can find them in the pickle section.
Absolutely delicious! Unloved it and can't wait to make it for my next family gathering. Thank you for this recipe. :)
Awesome! Made these with Tostitos Scoops & loved this!

These were great, and disappeared within minutes of coming out of the oven! Next time I will double the recipe! I used diced jalapenos from a jar. I did 2 tbsp of jalapenos and 1 tbsp of juice. I then skipped the hot sauce and left everything else the same. They were great!
I used a little more cream cheese and only 1 jalapeno. I used Tostitos scoops, and put the dish in the microwave to heat it up. Delicious!

These were perfect! I didn't have bacon bits so just omitted that step. My only complaint is that this didn't make very many. I used pasty puff sheet and pinched them up at the top. The recipe only made 10.
I made it according to the recipe and they turned out great.

I followed the helpful suggestions of others and these came out great. I doubled the recipe to make 30 poppers; our shells come in packages of 15 each. I used real bacon, two tablespoons of diced jalapeño from a jar, and made the mix a day ahead so it had time to get happy. I cut the corner off the ziplock bag and piped neatly into the phyllo shells. They took about 25 minutes to bake and were gone in 5 minutes.
I couldn't find individual cups so I used a sheet instead. Cut them with a biscuit cutter. I was unsure how they would turn out, but they were a hit! Definitely a keeper.
Very tasty! These are great served in phyllo shells or scoops tortilla chips.
Great

These are fantastic prepared as written! I did leave out the bacon bits since I didn't have any and used sriracha for the hot sauce. Use the phyllo cups, they add a delicate crisp texture and fresh jalapeño so they don't taste pickled. My 23 year old nephew popped one in his mouth and said "these are amazing". They were demolished in minutes! Definitely recommend this recipe ??

Can we talk about all the friends I made at the Nascar tailgate last weekend because of this recipe?! I doubled it. I made 30 phyllo cups with homemade bacon bits, fat free cream cheese, and some seeds from the jalapeños. I also did the piping from a bag trick to make it quicker and easier. I will make this again and again and again.
Doubled the recipe and everyone loved them.
I make these for my annual Christmas party here in Texas, always a bit hit
These are AWESOME! Everyone raves about them. I do add some cheddar cheese, but great without also!! Thanks

So simple to make, but, packs a flavor punch! I made exactly as the recipe stated, but, substituted ground Johnsonville Italian Sausage for the bacon. The sausage worked perfectly with the cream cheese and jalapenos and really kicked these tasty jalapeno cups up a notch. I used Cholula for the hot sauce. If you can't find phyllo cups you can use regular phyllo and form to your mini muffin pan or even pie crust would be great. I will definitely be making these again.

These are excellent appetizers. It’s a perfect ratio of cream cheese to cheddar cheese and the phyllo shells work great with it – crispy and light. I try to find occasions to make this and I’m running out now that football’s over :-)
I doubled the recipe, but otherwise it was exactly as the recipe was written. Yummy.

Super easy! I doubled the recipe and used 2 red and 2 green jalapenos since they were Christmas appetizers. I combined the ingredients in a ziploc using reduced fat cream cheese and a blend of full fat and reduced fat cheddar. I microwaved the bag about 15 seconds and snipped off the corner to pipe the filling into the cups. I got side tracked and didn't bake them until an hour later and they turned out fine. Will make again!
Added crumbled pork sausage and yellow pepper. They were gone in minutes. Definitely use a plastic bag to pipe into the shells. Makes for an easy and enjoyable appetizer! LOVE LOVE LOVE!
These were great and so easy. I did cut back on the hot sauce because my peppers were pretty hot on their own.
I worked with a woman years ago who made these. She used wonton wrappers instead. Thanks I had long since lost the recipe for these things....

Absolutely wonderful. I like this idea much better than a whole Jalapeno stuffed, believe me. Second time we left the bacon off and enjoyed just as much with cheese topping. Had to watch carefully and broil the last minute or two. Careful is the operative word!!! Burn easily.

I thought these were a fun idea for our superbowl potluck. I put the filling in a baggie, snipped a corner and piped filling into scoops chips rather than phyllo cups. Most people enjoyed these but thought the hot sauce made the filling taste more like hot wings rather than jalapeno poppers.
So tasty and good! This is a fabulous recipe!
My guests thought they were great! When I'm by myself, I make the filling recipe and microwave it. It makes a great hot dip for corn chips!
This was amazing! My husband and I both devoured them...Thanks for the recipe; I will be making this again for sure!

I've made this both in the phyllo cups, and doubled it and served in a casserole as a dip - much preferred as a dip with Scoops, it went over much better that way. I diced up bacon and added most of it in to the cream cheese mixture, reserving just a little bit for garnish to sprinkle over the top (used the already-cooked kind, 1/2 package when I made a single recipe in the phyllo cups, and a whole package when I doubled the recipe and put it in a casserole as a dip.)
Recipe needs more jalapeno and is too creamy, one or two is good, but then it is just too much.
have not tried yet..but sounds great

This is a great recipe for people who not only have just a few peppers but also for those people who don't like too much heat. The crunch of the phyllo adds wonderful texture. This isn't my favorite popper recipe but it is a great one regardless!

This was really good and very easy! I've tried this in phyllo cups and scoop chips and the scoop chip are definitely the way to go! Definitely use two seeded jalapeños, as the heat is largely reduced by the cream cheese. The last time I made it I accidentally added 8oz of cream cheese and a little extra shredded cheese--it was a happy mistake! Doubled the recipe without reducing the flavor. These are even great the day after!
Quick, Easy. Double recipe and use only 3 jalapenos. Use "red hot" for hot pepper sauce
me and my family loves Jalapeno Poppers!
I didn't like this recipe. I didn't get any spice out of it and very little flavor.
I used pickled jalapeno and should have used fresh. Overall, a good way to serve poppers, but not special.
This was a good quick snack. I used scoops instead cause that is all I had and they turned out great. I also sprinkled a little garlic salt in them mix. Will make again!!

2 peppers was just a tad too spicy for me, even without using the hot pepper sauce, but hubby thought them perfect. They disappeared quickly! I will make again, but a double batch, less peppers & no hot sauce in one batch for me & the recipe exactly as stated for the hot hubby! I did eat two...so they are yummy. Piping the mixture in using a corner-cut baggy was key in not breaking the mini cups. I baked them first for about 5 mins, piped the mix in, then baked again another 5 mins. They were good at room temp & not at all soggy.

The entire family loves these. Have them when we want a nice snack or when we have guests for dinner. We never change a thing besides roming the seeds sometimes in the jalapenos and sometimes not for some extra heat.
Made these for a party and everybody loved them! They were gone in minutes. I used less jalapenos then the recipes called for and it still turned out awesome!
Pretty good. Used bacon instead of bacon bits. Did not hold up well overnight.
So good! My husband can't quit eating them. I used Baked Scoops and low fat cream cheese - they still taste amazing. Thanks!!
Awesome and quick! I have used this several times and its always a big hit. I have added red peppers too for a little pizzazz.
